organic_results.title: Agricultural Organization and Educational Consumption in the US in 1900
organic_results.snippet: Most previous studies of the development of national educational systems have focused on the role of changes in the urban-industrial social structure. In contrast, this article investigates the importance of the organization of agriculture--the degree of mechanization, the availability of farmland, and the extent of farm ownership. The analysis focuses on variations in educational consumption across states and counties in the United States in 1900, when the school system was in mid-transition to its contemporary pattern. The data …
